data.title: MP server browser should _always_ list the current mod first
OpenRA.Game.exe mod support
data.body:
Dear Devs,

Not many mods feature space but I found Nomad Galaxy (http://www.moddb.com/mods/nomad-galaxy) and tried to give Nolt support on displaying "skybox".

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sFV7S5zTavY

I sort of did it but the problem is, the background image and tile display code is in OpenRA.Game module, not DLL. Any suggestions on distributing such modifications for gamers to play? Also, per-map background image also modifies OpenRA.Game code, there is no way I can avoid modifying the very core part of the engine.

My changes:
https://github.com/forcecore/OpenRA/commit/27959a17afca9a716c85d64eaa6adc44dba0164a

data.title: Add support for sight 'cones'
data.body: What I'd like to see implemented is support for 'directional sight', instead of revealing shroud/fog in a circle around the actor.

Removed exception "Failed to register currrent mod metadata
System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added." from debug.log on each OpenRA launch and some loading exceptions in debugger.

data.title: Improve master server response error messages.
Fix flickering tooltip in slow speed game and Map editor
data.body:
Closes #13335
Closes #12356

data.title: Multi-Layered maps
data.body:
For my KKnD mod, i need at last 2 different Map-Layers. Thats why i'll explain two approaches: The one which would fit my needs, and the "done-right"-way.

**The bare minimum**
For KKnD, i need a top Layer which is drawn over all non-flying aircrafts. This includes projectiles except bomber bombs and artillery fire. In the CnC games maps are consisting of either terrain or placed buildings. That allows them to be actors actualy. In KKnD, buildings are part of the terrain and tileset. Also in KKnD buildings can be extremely large, which would result in blocking a lot of tiles if placed on ground level. Thats why the originally KKnD map format has a second layer. The second layer contains tiles, which units can move behind/under. Here is an example:
http://www.gamersglobal.de/sites/gamersglobal.de/files/galerie/kknd2_04.jpg
And here are the actual KKnD Maps decompiled and rendered per-layer:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B8R1h_nsUmf6eDZVWXROYS1JbWs
The maps .bin format could be extended in several ways:

1. Just make the tiles block twice as large, adding a full second layer. But this would make all maps files larger, and most mods do not need this feature.
2. Add a second tiles offset, which if not 0 points to a top-layer. Makes all other maps exactly 4 bytes larger.
3. Add a single byte before the tile offsets containing the number-of-layers, followed by the same amount of tile offsets. This would make other maps eactly 1 byte larger.

This also requires the renderer to call the render function n-times. Instead of rendering terrain, followed by actors, it has to call both with the layer parameter. Not sure about performance here, but might be a good idea to encapsulate actors into some per-layer-sets, so you do not have to read all the actors twice and checking their layer. Because flying units have to be on layer 1

A General problem would be that OpenRA allows you to use tileID 0. So there is no unused or null tile. This means that either:

1. tileID 0 should get forbidden in tilesets and has to be moved. (0x000000 in the .bin, and also my favourite)
1. a specific tile has to be reserved for "unused" (im for using 0xFFFFFF in the .bin)
2. a tileset can define a single tileID as "empty".

**The right way (as i think it is)**
OpenRA already has heights. Basically its just a property a tile can have. Thats why i suggest moving towards a 3D tiled map. (It does not have to be rendered in 3d!) A map will not only have a width (x) and height (y), but also layers (z). Layers are the equivalent of the current height implementation. However its possible to actualy place multiple tiles at the same x,y position, if their z position differs. (Think of Minecraft worlds). This allows the world to be rendered layer by layer, or by rendering the highest tile per x,y plus the tile beneath if it uses the alpha palette color. This also allows things like bridges-over-bridges. Also this information can be used for visibility checks (needed by KKnD 2).

To make units drive up/down to another layer, specific tiles could be marked as slopes. This would allow mods to actualy stretch the battlefield across multiple layers. Here an example from Metal Fatigue:
Basicaly you start on the ground level, building up your base, building units etc:
http://www.myabandonware.com/media/screenshots/m/metal-fatigue-bx5/metal-fatigue_15.jpg
Then you are able to build an elevator, which allows you to send units underground. There you have to dig through a place you like, place another elevator and voila, you got a tunnel setup.
http://www.myabandonware.com/media/screenshots/m/metal-fatigue-bx5/metal-fatigue_16.jpg
This allows realy interesting ambush tactics. This game also uses a "cloud" layer. You can send units up using a transport aircraft and establish another base there.
http://www.myabandonware.com/media/screenshots/m/metal-fatigue-bx5/metal-fatigue_13.jpg
The only thing the engine has to allow for this, is a simple way to set visible layers. Either see all at once, or see all till a specific tile, or see only one at once.

With this solution, some other interesting features can be used:
- Crashing planes will not teleport upwards a cliff when they crash down on the lower side.
- Units might see or shoot up/down a hill, or not.
- Units might shoot further if shooting downwards.
- Artillery firing from below a bridge wont make projectiles go straight through the bridge as it hits the tiles above.

For the editor a simple layer widget has to be added, which allows to toggle layer visibility, plus set the current working layer. All newly placed actors and tiles will be placed at this layer. Tilesets may define templates involving multiple layers at once. For example a building template will place at the current layer, but its top-parts will automatically be placed on the layer above.

As this is a rather big feature, i expect this being discussed heavily before someone starts working on it. It would also require to be split down into multiple smaller feature implementations.

data.title: Frozen attack fix

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.title: Catch and ignore exceptions while loading map previews.
data.body: Fixes #12830.

data.title: ResourceCenter: Carry over stats to next revision [feature]
data.body:
Hi,
by uploading a new revision of a map, the "played" statistic gets reset - so it looks like the map has never been played before. This is kind of disheartening ^^. I would like to request this to be changed so that the statistic is accumulated over all revisions.

This applies to the "viewed ", "downloaded"  and "rated" as well.
Especially in rating this would be important. Currently this disencourages uploading revisions (if you care for the rating) and rating other maps yourself, since the rating will disappear anyway if the map is improved.

data.title: Polish the windows make and launcher scripts
data.body: Fixes issues discovered during the writing/review of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModTemplate/pull/3.

data.title: Always make sure to be on the host actor when repairing
data.body:
Fixes #13357.

The `Rearm` activity is not affected, is it checks directly for the host actor below, while `Repair` gets the host as parameter and only checks for adjacency when `CloseEnough > 0`.

data.title: RA: Vehicles can be repaired in place on different island than service depot
data.body:
When you put a service depot on an island, you can repair all vehicles in place (using buildings repair tool). 
Including your MCV when not deployed, = very quick repair :) 

Also great for mammoth attack = when they get fired upon, constant repair :)

data.title: Introduce an `INotifyTeleporting` interface to decouple mod-specific behaviour.
data.body:
The RA chronoshift quirks (killing cargo, exploding demo trucks) don't belong in our otherwise generic teleporting logic.  Implementing an interface would let us move these behaviours to external traits and make it easier for mods to implement their own (e.g. playing warp in/out animations or effects).

I suggest:
```csharp
public interface INotifyTeleporting { void Teleporting(Actor self, CPos source, CPos destination); }
```

At least the `Teleport` activity and `PortableChrono` trait could then be moved into Mods.Common.  I'm not sure whether it is worth moving `Chronoshiftable` and `ChronoshiftPower`.

Related to #6336.

data.title: TS - EMPed units continue to fire if was already firing

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
i.e. They don't lose target when EMPed. You can test by EMPing a unit forcefiring to ground.

Adding `RequiresCondition: !empdisable` to `Arrament:`s of each unit can be a solution. But in that case they would be unable to get a new attack command while EMPed, but they can get a move or deploy command for example.

data.title: Add KillCargo and FlashScreen to PortableChrono
Add Actor Categories and Categories dropdown filter in Map editor
data.body:
Closes #10139

Add Actor categories:
V01:
..EditorTilesetFilter:
....ExcludeTilesets: DESERT
....**Categories: Building, Civilian**

Add Categories dropdown filter in Map editor:

![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/26562808/3a1a6a80-44ca-11e7-8490-8ea4afd17517.png)

Categories list is combined from all existing categories of all actors.

EditorTilesetFilter can be renamed but due to currently broken Utility, hundreds of changed files (due to renaming or removed comments), I prefer to do it in another PR or at least lately as final commit after review of this PR.

data.title: Smarter Variable Linting (Removal of Dummy Properties)
Catch and ignore BeaconLib errors, stop Beacon on closing server browser
data.body:
Fixes #13348

There is another PR to update BeaconLib to support also frameworks with missing AllowNatTraversal, which I assume is not mandatory for this feature.
+
The LAN probe wasn't disposed, stop it on closing browser.

data.title: Refactor WithAttackAnimation to support multiple sprite bodies
data.body:
Same approach as with `WithMoveAnimation`.

Additionally, reduced string.NullOrEmpty look-ups and made sure the aim/reload sequences don't override a playing attack anim.

data.title: Tweak TS sprite mechs visuals

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
- renames 'run' sequence to 'walk'
- replaces the no-longer-necessary WithInfantryBody on the Titan
- adjusts Tick rates of walk anims and Wolverine attack anim
- fixes barrel, armament offsets of Titan and disables bullet image on `120mm`

data.title: Move package loaders to mod code.
data.body:
This is the final followup item from #13223.

This also marks a notable milestone: our core engine is now, except for the voxel loader, completely clean of format loaders or other algorithms used by the original games.

data.title: OpenRA does not consider turning on the spot a movement
data.body: In original TS, mechs played their walking anim even when turning on the spot (which makes sense), in OpenRA they don't.

data.title: Remove legacy FileSystem.OpenPackage(string, IReadOnlyPackage).
data.body: Fixes one of the followup items from #13223.

data.title: Rework read/write zip file loading/saving.
data.body: Fixes #13330 and the issue where edited maps appear multiple times in the map picker.

data.title: aftermatch expansion: can not import music
data.body:
Hello,

OpenRA can not import music from my mounted iso (627 Mo), I obtain this error log from install.log:

System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path "/usr/lib/openra/SETUP/INSTALL/PATCH.RTP".
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode, System.IO.FileAccess access, System.IO.FileShare share, System.Int32 bufferSize, System.Boolean anonymous, System.IO.FileOptions options) [0x001cf] in <8f2c484307284b51944a1a13a14c0266>:0

data.title: Make Explodes conditional and implement TS elite explosions

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
And use that to replicate original `EXPLODES` elite ability.
Fixes a part of #13209.

Note: I don't know how exactly the damage was calculated in the original, so my choice was a bit arbitrary and might need some fine-tuning.

data.title: TS - Implement some of missing Elite Abilities

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
Fixes some parts of #13209.

> Explodes: and AppearsOnRadar: looks unconditionable, Mobile: doesn't allow multipile instances. So RADAR_INVISIBLE, CRUSHER and EXPLODES are not possible just with .yaml editing.

> SMECH looks like already have ImmuneToVeins=yes and we coded them like so, so it is unnecessary on it.
